title: Peter Thiel Political Evolution Timeline (1998-2019)
description: Document Thiel's systematic transformation from libertarian tech entrepreneur to post-liberal authoritarian, including key intellectual influences and strategic pivots
source_document: The Capture Cascade - Part 4: The Bridge.pdf
research_notes: Generated from systematic analysis of Silicon Valley networks as transmission belts for oligarchic capture. Focus on specific dates, financial transactions, personnel movements, and institutional coordination mechanisms.
research_areas: 1998 - PayPal co-founding with vision of 'online payments revolution free from government interference'
2004 - 'The Straussian Moment' essay arguing 9/11 upended old political order requiring governance reexamination
2009 - Cato Unbound essay declaring 'I no longer believe that freedom and democracy are compatible'
Critique of welfare expansion and women's suffrage since 1920 rendering 'capitalist democracy' an 'oxymoron'
Late 2010s - Strategic pivot from escaping democracy to confronting and reshaping it
2019 - National Conservatism Conference inaugural address becoming celebrity patron of New Right scene
